Articles.Content:
The indicators to begin and start a burn are unclear if it automatically burns I wouldn’t have to worry about that if this is considered then make sure you can turn the feature on and of.

 

Copy and paste this for the private division launcher feedback please.

Edited May 23, 2023 by Pat20999

I would also like this feature.  It would make simple, yet fully automated craft possible.

Though it might not be as simple to implement as you might think.  Once the maneuver planner gets to the point where it's time to take action, that action isn't always the same.  I think the most common scenarios involve triggering a stage or throttling up.  But even both of these are aren't always so clear cut.  Sometimes I will have my decouple action and engine activation action in the same stage.  Sometimes I won't.  Most of the time I will just hit full throttle, but sometimes I need to throttle up more gently so as to not induce unwanted rotation of my craft.

On a bit of a tangent.  The MechJeb KSP1 mod comes to mind.  I never used it, but I think it does this.  And I think it does quite alot more.

All that said, I still want this.  I think something like a simple checkbox or two in the maneuver planner could work here. A checkbox for auto activate stage, and one for auto full throttle.

Just now, Pat20999 said:

And like it if you Copy and paste this for the launcher.

Not sure what you mean by "copy paste this for the launcher"

For feedback, I apologise for being unclear.

Edited May 23, 2023 by Pat20999
How are they unclear exactly? You get lights and a countdown. Throttle up on green or 0.

3 minutes ago, The Aziz said:

How are they unclear exactly? You get lights and a countdown. Throttle up on green or 0.

I find the bar to be a bit confusing.  It could align better with the staging moments.

But, I mostly just want the feature Pat20999 described.

The light is green before it hits 0. And autoburn should be cool if you were for example eating and you forgot to stop burning. Maybe it’s just me with a bug. I don’t know but autoburn is still a good idea.
